intro: Maesobotrya villosa, commonly known as the hairy maesobotrya, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow in color. Maesobotrya villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
